name: abilityCheck
title: Ability Check
description: An ability check is a D20 Test that represents using an Ability to accomplish a task.

name: abilityScoreAndModifier
title: Ability Score and Modifier
description: Each ability has a score from 1 to 30 that represents the magnitude of that ability. Each ability also has a modifier derived from its score that you apply whenever you make a D20 Test with that ability.

name: action
title: Action
description: When you do something other than moving or communicating, you typically take an action. On your turn, you can take one action. The game uses actions to govern how much you can do at one time.

name: advantage
title: Advantage
description: Advantage reflects positive circumstances surrounding a d20 roll. When you have Advantage, you roll two d20s and use the higher of the two rolls.

name: adventure
title: Adventure
description: An adventure is a series of encounters. A story emerges through playing them.

name: alignment
title: Alignment
description: A creature's alignment broadly describes its ethical attitudes and ideals. Alignment is a combination of two factors: one identifies morality (good, evil, or neutral), and the other describes attitudes toward order (lawful, chaotic, or neutral). These factors allow for nine possible combinations.

name: ally
title: Ally
description: A creature is your ally if it is a member of your adventuring party, your friend, on your side in combat, or a creature that the rules or the GM designates as your ally.

name: areaOfEffect
title: Area of Effect
description: The descriptions of many spells and other features specify that they have an area of effect, which typically has one of six shapes. An area of effect has a point of origin from which the effect's energy erupts.

name: armorClass
title: Armor Class
description: A creature's Armor Class represents how well the creature avoids being wounded in combat. AC is the target number for an attack roll, with a base calculation of 10 plus Dexterity modifier.

name: armorTraining
title: Armor Training
description: Armor training allows you to use armor of a certain category without drawbacks. Without training, you have Disadvantage on Strength or Dexterity D20 Tests and can't cast spells while wearing armor.

name: attackRoll
title: Attack Roll
description: An attack roll is a D20 Test used to determine whether an attack hits or misses a target. The attack hits if the roll equals or exceeds the target's Armor Class.

name: attitude
title: Attitude
description: A monster has a starting attitude toward a player character: Friendly, Hostile, or Indifferent.

name: attunement
title: Attunement
description: Some magic items require a creature to form a bond called Attunement with them before the creature can use the item's magical properties. A creature can have Attunement with no more than three magic items at a time.

name: bonusAction
title: Bonus Action
description: A Bonus Action is an additional action on your turn that can only be taken when a special ability, spell, or feature specifically states you can do something as a Bonus Action. You can take only one Bonus Action per turn.

name: breakingObjects
title: Breaking Objects
description: Objects can be harmed by attacks and spells. Fragile objects can be automatically broken with the Attack or Utilize action. More resilient objects have AC and Hit Points that must be overcome.

name: brightLight
title: Bright Light
description: Bright Light is normal illumination.

name: burrowSpeed
title: Burrow Speed
description: A creature that has a Burrow Speed can use that speed to move through sand, earth, mud, or ice. The creature can't burrow through solid rock unless the creature has a trait that allows it to do so.

name: campaign
title: Campaign
description: A campaign is a series of adventures.

name: cantrip
title: Cantrip
description: A cantrip is a level 0 spell, which is cast without a spell slot.

name: carryingCapacity
title: Carrying Capacity
description: Your size and Strength score determine the maximum weight in pounds that you can carry. You can also drag, lift, or push additional weight. While carrying excess weight, your Speed can be no more than 5 feet.

name: challengeRating
title: Challenge Rating
description: Challenge Rating (CR) summarizes the threat a monster poses to a group of four player characters. Compare a monster's CR to the characters' level to gauge relative danger.

name: characterSheet
title: Character Sheet
description: A character sheet is a paper or digital record that you use to track your character's information.

name: climbSpeed
title: Climb Speed
description: A Climb Speed can be used in place of Speed to traverse a vertical surface without expending the extra movement normally associated with climbing.

name: climbing
title: Climbing
description: While you're climbing, each foot of movement costs 1 extra foot (2 extra feet in Difficult Terrain). You ignore this extra cost if you have a Climb Speed and use it to climb.

name: condition
title: Condition
description: A condition is a temporary game state that affects its recipient. The definition of a condition says how it affects its recipient, and various rules define how to end a condition.

name: cone
title: Cone
description: A Cone is an area of effect that extends in straight lines from a point of origin in a direction its creator chooses. A Cone's width at any point is equal to that point's distance from the point of origin.

name: cover
title: Cover
description: Cover provides a degree of protection to a target behind it. There are three degrees: Half Cover (+2 bonus to AC and Dexterity saves), Three-Quarters Cover (+5 bonus), and Total Cover (can't be targeted directly).

name: crawling
title: Crawling
description: While you're crawling, each foot of movement costs 1 extra foot (2 extra feet in Difficult Terrain).

name: creature
title: Creature
description: Any being in the game, including a player's character, is a creature.

name: criticalHit
title: Critical Hit
description: If you roll a 20 on the d20 for an attack roll, you score a Critical Hit, and the attack hits regardless of modifiers or AC. Roll all damage dice twice and add them together, then add relevant modifiers.

name: cube
title: Cube
description: A Cube is an area of effect that extends in straight lines from a point of origin located anywhere on a face of the Cube. The effect that creates a Cube specifies its size, which is the length of each side.

name: curses
title: Curses
description: Some game effects curse a creature or an object. The effect that confers a curse defines what the curse does. Curses can be removed by the Remove Curse and Greater Restoration spells or other magic that explicitly ends curses.

name: cylinder
title: Cylinder
description: A Cylinder is an area of effect that extends in straight lines from a point of origin located at the center of the circular top or bottom of the Cylinder. The effect specifies the radius of the base and the height.

name: d20Test
title: D20 Test
description: D20 Tests encompass the three main d20 rolls of the game: ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. If something affects D20 Tests, it affects all three of these rolls.

name: damage
title: Damage
description: Damage represents harm that causes a creature or an object to lose Hit Points.

name: damageRoll
title: Damage Roll
description: A damage roll is a die roll, adjusted by any applicable modifiers, that deals damage to a target.

name: damageThreshold
title: Damage Threshold
description: A creature or object with a damage threshold has Immunity to all damage unless it takes damage equal to or greater than its threshold from a single attack or effect, in which case it takes that entire instance of damage.

name: damageTypes
title: Damage Types
description: Attacks and other harmful effects deal different types of damage. Damage types have no rules of their own, but other rules, such as Resistance, rely on the types. Types include Acid, Bludgeoning, Cold, Fire, Force, Lightning, Necrotic, Piercing, Poison, Psychic, Radiant, Slashing, and Thunder.

name: darkness
title: Darkness
description: An area of Darkness is Heavily Obscured.

name: dead
title: Dead
description: A dead creature has no Hit Points and can't regain them unless it is first revived by magic such as the Raise Dead or Revivify spell. The spirit has left the body and departed for the Outer Planes.

name: deathSavingThrow
title: Death Saving Throw
description: A player character must make a Death Saving Throw (also called a Death Save) if they start their turn with 0 Hit Points.

name: difficultTerrain
title: Difficult Terrain
description: If a space is Difficult Terrain, every foot of movement in that space costs 1 extra foot. For example, moving 5 feet through Difficult Terrain costs 10 feet of movement.

name: difficultyClass
title: Difficulty Class
description: A Difficulty Class (DC) is the target number for an ability check or a saving throw.

name: dimLight
title: Dim Light
description: An area with Dim Light is Lightly Obscured.

name: disadvantage
title: Disadvantage
description: If you have Disadvantage on a D20 Test, roll two d20s and use the lower roll. A roll can't be affected by more than one Disadvantage, and Advantage and Disadvantage cancel each other.

name: emanation
title: Emanation
description: An Emanation is an area of effect that extends in straight lines from a creature or an object in all directions. The effect specifies the distance it extends.

name: encounter
title: Encounter
description: An encounter is a scene in an adventure that is part of at least one of the game's three pillars: social interaction, exploration, or combat.

name: enemy
title: Enemy
description: A creature is your enemy if it fights against you in combat, actively works to harm you, or is designated as your enemy by the rules or GM.

name: experiencePoints
title: Experience Points
description: As they overcome challenges and complete adventures, characters earn Experience Points (XP), which are awarded by the Game Master. When a character's XP total crosses certain thresholds, the character's level increases.

name: expertise
title: Expertise
description: Expertise is a feature that enhances your use of a skill proficiency. When you make an ability check with a skill proficiency in which you have Expertise, your Proficiency Bonus is doubled for that check unless the bonus is doubled by another feature.

name: flySpeed
title: Fly Speed
description: A Fly Speed can be used to travel through the air. While you have a Fly Speed, you can stay aloft until you land, fall, or die.

name: flying
title: Flying
description: A variety of effects allow a creature to fly. While flying, you fall if you have the Incapacitated or Prone condition or your Fly Speed is reduced to 0. You can stay aloft in those circumstances if you can hover.

name: friendly
title: Friendly
description: A Friendly creature views you favorably. You have Advantage on an ability check to influence a Friendly creature.

name: grappling
title: Grappling
description: A creature can grapple another creature. Characters typically grapple by using an Unarmed Strike. Successfully grappling a creature gives it the Grappled condition.

name: hazard
title: Hazard
description: A hazard is an environmental danger.

name: healing
title: Healing
description: Healing is how you regain Hit Points.

name: heavilyObscured
title: Heavily Obscured
description: You have the Blinded condition while trying to see something in a Heavily Obscured space.

name: heroicInspiration
title: Heroic Inspiration
description: If you (a player character) have Heroic Inspiration, you can expend it to reroll any die immediately after rolling it, and you must use the new roll. You can never have more than one instance of Heroic Inspiration.

name: highJump
title: High Jump
description: When you make a High Jump, you leap into the air a number of feet equal to 3 plus your Strength modifier (minimum of 0 feet) if you move at least 10 feet on foot immediately before the jump. When you make a standing High Jump, you can jump only half that distance.

name: hitPointDice
title: Hit Point Dice
description: Hit Point Dice, or Hit Dice for short, help determine a player character's Hit Point maximum. A creature can spend Hit Dice during a Short Rest to regain Hit Points.

name: hitPoints
title: Hit Points
description: Hit Points (HP) are a measure of how difficult it is to kill or destroy a creature or an object. Damage reduces Hit Points, and healing restores them. You can't have more Hit Points than your Hit Point maximum, and you can't have less than 0.

name: hostile
title: Hostile
description: A Hostile creature views you unfavorably. You have Disadvantage on an ability check to influence a Hostile creature.

name: hover
title: Hover
description: Some creatures can hover, as noted in their stat blocks, and some spells and other effects grant the ability to hover. Hovering while flying prevents you from falling in certain circumstances.

name: illusions
title: Illusions
description: Spells and other effects sometimes create magical illusions. Such an effect defines what the illusion does and which senses or mental faculties it deceives. If an illusion manifests in space, the illusion is insubstantial and weightless.

name: immunity
title: Immunity
description: If you have Immunity to a damage type or a condition, it doesn't affect you in any way.

name: improvisedWeapons
title: Improvised Weapons
description: An improvised weapon is an object wielded as a makeshift weapon, such as broken glass, a table leg, or a frying pan. Don't add your Proficiency Bonus to attack rolls with an improvised weapon. On a hit, the weapon deals 1d4 damage of a type the GM thinks is appropriate.

name: indifferent
title: Indifferent
description: An Indifferent creature has no desire to help or hinder you. Indifferent is the default attitude of a monster.

name: initiative
title: Initiative
description: Initiative determines the order of turns during combat. When combat starts, every participant rolls Initiative; they make a Dexterity check that determines their place in the Initiative order.

name: jumping
title: Jumping
description: When you jump, you make either a Long Jump (horizontal) or a High Jump (vertical).

name: knockingOutACreature
title: Knocking Out A Creature
description: When you would reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points with a melee attack, you can instead reduce the creature to 1 Hit Point. The creature then has the Unconscious condition and starts a Short Rest.

name: lightlyObscured
title: Lightly Obscured
description: You have Disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to see something in a Lightly Obscured space.

name: line
title: Line
description: A Line is an area of effect that extends from a point of origin in a straight path along its length and covers an area defined by its width. The effect that creates a Line specifies its length and width.

name: longJump
title: Long Jump
description: When you make a Long Jump, you leap horizontally a number of feet up to your Strength score if you move at least 10 feet immediately before the jump. When you make a standing Long Jump, you can leap only half that distance.

name: magicalEffect
title: Magical Effect
description: An effect is magical if it is created by a spell, a magic item, or a phenomenon that a rule labels as magical.

name: monster
title: Monster
description: A monster is a creature controlled by the GM, even if the creature is benevolent.

name: multiclassing
title: Multiclassing
description: Multiclassing allows you to gain levels in multiple classes. With this rule, you have the option of gaining a level in a new class whenever you advance in level instead of gaining a level in your current class.

name: nonplayerCharacter
title: Nonplayer Character
description: A nonplayer character (NPC) is a monster that has a personal name and a distinct personality.

name: object
title: Object
description: An object is a nonliving, distinct thing. Composite things, like buildings, comprise more than one object.

name: occupiedSpace
title: Occupied Space
description: A space is occupied if a creature is in it or if it is completely filled by objects.

name: passivePerception
title: Passive Perception
description: Passive Perception is a score that reflects a creature's general awareness of its surroundings. The GM uses this score when determining whether a creature notices something without consciously making a Wisdom (Perception) check.

name: perDay
title: Per Day
description: If a rule says you can use something a certain number of times per day, that means you must finish a Long Rest to use it again after you run out of uses.

name: playerCharacter
title: Player Character
description: A player character is a character controlled by a player.

name: possession
title: Possession
description: Some effects cause a creature to be possessed by another creature or entity. A possessing effect defines how the possession operates.

name: proficiency
title: Proficiency
description: If you have proficiency with something, you can add your Proficiency Bonus to any D20 Test you make using that thing. A creature might have proficiency in a skill or saving throw or with a weapon or tool.

name: reaction
title: Reaction
description: A Reaction is a special action taken in response to a trigger defined in the Reaction's description. You can take a Reaction on another creature's turn, and if you take it on your turn, you can do so even if you also take an action, a Bonus Action, or both.

name: resistance
title: Resistance
description: If you have Resistance to a damage type, damage of that type is halved against you (round down). Resistance is applied only once to an instance of damage.

name: ritual
title: Ritual
description: If you have a spell prepared that has the Ritual tag, you can cast that spell as a Ritual. The Ritual version of a spell takes 10 minutes longer to cast than normal. It also doesn't expend a spell slot, which means the ritual version of a spell can't be cast at a higher level. See also "Spells."

name: roundDown
title: Round Down
description: Whenever you divide or multiply a number in the game, round down if you end up with a fraction, even if the fraction is one-half or greater. Some rules make an exception and tell you to round up.

name: save
title: Save
description: Save is another name for a saving throw. See also "Saving Throw."

name: savingThrow
title: Saving Throw
description: s

name: shapeShifting
title: Shape-Shifting
description: If an effect, such as Wild Shape or the Polymorph spell, lets you shape-shift, its description specifies what happens to you. Unless that description says otherwise, any ongoing effects on you—conditions, spells, curses, and the like—carry over from one form to the other. You revert to your true form if you die.

name: shortRest
title: Short Rest
description: A Short Rest is a 1-hour period of downtime, during which a creature does nothing more strenuous than reading, talking, eating, or standing watch. To start a Short Rest, you must have at least 1 Hit Point.

name: simultaneousEffects
title: Simultaneous Effects
description: If two or more things happen at the same time on a turn, the person at the game table—player or GM whose turn it is decides the order in which those things happen. For example, if two effects occur at the start of a player character's turn, the player decides which of the effects happens first.

name: size
title: Size
description: Your character's species determines the character's size. Individuals within a species cover a wide range of heights, and some species include such diversity of size that you can choose whether your character is Small or Medium.

name: skill
title: Skill
description: List

name: speed
title: Speed
description: A ship sailing against a strong wind moves at half speed. In a dead calm (no wind), waterborne ships can't move under sail and must be rowed. Keelboats and Rowboats are used on lakes and rivers. If going downstream, add the speed of the current (typically 3 miles per hour) to the speed of the vehicle. These vehicles can't be rowed against any significant current, but they can be pulled upstream by draft animals on the shores. A Rowboat can be carried and weighs 100 pounds.

name: spell
title: Spell
description: casting

name: spellAttack
title: Spell Attack
description: A spell attack is an attack roll made as part of a spell or another magical effect. See also "Spells" ("Casting Spells").

name: spellcastingFocus
title: Spellcasting Focus
description: A Spellcasting Focus is an object that certain creatures can use in place of a spell's Material components if those materials aren't consumed by the spell and don't have a cost specified. Some classes allow its members to use certain types of Spellcasting Focuses. See also "Spells" ("Casting Spells").

name: sphere
title: Sphere
description: [Area of Effect]

name: stable
title: Stable
description: A creature is Stable if it has 0 Hit Points but isn't required to make Death Saving Throws. See also "Playing the Game" ("Damage and Healing").

name: statBlock
title: Stat Block
description: A stat block contains the game statistics of a monster. Each stat block includes the following information presented after the monster's name.

name: swimSpeed
title: Swim Speed
description: A Swim Speed can be used to swim without expending the extra movement normally associated with swimming. See also "Swimming" and "Speed."

name: swimming
title: Swimming
description: While you're swimming, each foot of movement costs 1 extra foot (2 extra feet in Difficult Terrain). You ignore this extra cost if you have a Swim Speed and use it to swim. At the GM's option, moving any distance in rough water might require a successful DC 15 Strength (Athletics) check.

name: target
title: Target
description: s

name: telepathy
title: Telepathy
description: Telepathy is a magical ability that allows a creature to communicate mentally with another creature within a specified range. Unless a rule states otherwise, the contacted creature doesn't need to share a language with the telepath to understand this communication, but the contacted creature must be able to understand at least one language or be telepathic itself to understand.

name: teleportation
title: Teleportation
description: Teleportation is a special kind of magical transportation. If you teleport, you disappear and reappear elsewhere instantly, without moving through the intervening space. This transportation doesn't expend movement unless a rule tells you otherwise, and teleportation never provokes Opportunity Attacks.

name: temporaryHitPoints
title: Temporary Hit Points
description: Temporary Hit Points are granted by certain effects and act as a buffer against losing real Hit Points. See also "Playing the Game" ("Damage and Healing").

name: unarmedStrike
title: Unarmed Strike
description: Instead of using a weapon to make a melee attack, you can use a punch, kick, headbutt, or similar forceful blow. In game terms, this is an Unarmed Strike—a melee attack that involves you using your body to damage, grapple, or shove a target within 5 feet of you.

name: unoccupiedSpace
title: Unoccupied Space
description: A space is unoccupied if no creatures are in it and it isn't completely filled by objects.

name: vulnerability
title: Vulnerability
description: If you have Vulnerability to a damage type, damage of that type is doubled against you. Vulnerability is applied only once to an instance of damage.

name: weapon
title: Weapon
description: A weapon is an object that is in the Simple or Martial weapon category.

name: weaponAttack
title: Weapon Attack
description: A weapon attack is an attack roll made with a weapon.

name: weaponMasteryProperties
title: Weapon Mastery Properties
description: Each weapon has a mastery property, which is usable only by a character who has a feature, such as Weapon Mastery, that unlocks the property for the character.
